intro: Eremanthus pycnocephalus, commonly known as the thick-headed eremoblast, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in shrubland and coastal areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense heads. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
